page.title: 15A DAY ON DARTMOOR
page.content: We can see the moors from our school and we sometimes go there for field trips. On July 10th 1985 Class 8 did a walk from Cadover Bridge. We walked up a path beside the Plym and we saw some mortar stones which were evidence of tin streaming long ago. We went to Brisworthy Farm which is a hill farm where they grow crops and keep sheep. We then walked to a stone circle and a stone row, both of which were made in the Bronze Age about 2_3000 years ago. We also saw a kistvaen, a small granite tomb where they used to bury their dead. We buried Mark, he just fitted! We then climbed Legis Tor and at last had dinner! We found a vermin trap which farmers used to build to catch vermin when they bred rabbits here. Lastly we went down to the river and swam and played till it was time to walk back to the cars and go home.
